asyncResp everywhere. https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/65280

Sorry, I wasn't aware. Done.
- And there's something I can't figure out myself, I don't know if it's fine to ask here, hope you can help a bit. In this patch, I use readJsonPatch to read "PhysicalSecurity/IntrusionSensor" as this commit https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/50809 says I can do so. But when I use curl to do patch to it as below:
curl -X PATCH --user root:0penBmc -H "Content-Type: application/json" --insecure https://${BMC_IP}/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis -d '{"PhysicalSecurity": { "IntrusionSensor": "Normal" } }'
=> Everythign works fine. However, after the success msg of setting to the DBUS property, there's also a warning msg id "Base.1.16.0.PropertyUnknown" saying "The property PhysicalSecurity is not in the list of valid properties for the resource.". I've tried to back to readJsonPatch of PhysicalSecurity first, then read "IntrusionSensor" from it, but the warning msg is still shown. I guess it's from this line https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/fc3edfdd8b63c1efc4aed7e882584b6aec1b1a11/redfish-core/include/utils/json_utils.hpp#L464, but I don't know what leads to this.
It was just me reading json patch under one resource for different properties separately that caused the warning message. Updated the code to fix this.
Then debug here? Alternatively you could check the ec: if (ec.value() == ...) https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/DEVELOPING.md#logging-levels
I just wanted to log out the error message if it exists. But now I have changed it to logging the failure of the DBUS actions in general. I'm not sure if it addresses your concerns.
Shouldn't we also go to mapper to get this like we do the Get above?
Done

A warning here ? BMCWEB_LOG_WARNING since no internal error and this might not be an error. 
See https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/DEVELOPING.md#logging-levels
Done
This is a PATCH fail, should we return an InternalError?
Done. Thank you for your review.
Tested? Redfish validator ?
Redfish validator pass?
Sorry, I just ran the test and it passed Redfish Service Validator.
error_code by reference please.
Done

If this service is producing a correct phosphor-dbus-interface string, similar to "xyz.openbmc_project.Chassis.Intrusion.Rearm.Authomatic", this code is almost certainly wrong.  You need a method to convert.  Please take a look at any of the other examples.  Considering you didn't see failures, I'm assuming whatever service is producing this is incorrect.
I'm having the values of Status and Rearm property change to use full string dbus-sensors and waiting for review. Updated to add coversion method.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/58205 the patch to update these properties's values to use full string has been merged.
I don't see this as patchable?  Is this property useful if it can't be patched?

Because the latest Redfish Resource and Schema Guide dictates this as read-only. I think this is meant to be configurated from the beginning and just to show what the method to restore the sensor's state is. The one has influence on how the IntrusionSensor property should be interpreted.

>  I think this is meant to be configurated from the beginning

if it's configured from the beginning, do we need to read it from dbus at all?  Just hardcode the value if it can't be changed?

> Have you engaged Redfish about making this readwrite? If not, can you please do that

I have posted a thread in their forum and are waiting for reply.

> if it's configured from the beginning, do we need to read it from dbus at all? Just hardcode the value if it can't be changed?

I don't understand when you said hardcode. Can you please clarify a bit more? Because the intrusionsensor daemon from dbus-sensors also needs this property (which is configured in entity-manager) to handle works. Did you mean that we should only get it from dbus once and use it for the whole lifetime of the bmcweb service?

> Have you engaged Redfish about making this readwrite? If not, can you please do that

One admin from redfishforum.com replied to my question of whether to set this as read-write:
> To date, we've seen this as something managed by the system vendor and an end user is not able to modify this. If we do make this a writable property, that doesn't force everyone down this path; vendors can still implement it following their product's policy. If you really see a need for an end user to modify this, I can raise this to others to discuss if we should open this to be writable.

(https://redfishforum.com/thread/921/intrusionsensorrearm-property-read-clarification)

I personally don't have a reason to want it to be writable, because my company defines the method as Manual in our spec and doesn't plan for users to change it. Do you have any suggestion?

What is read-only here is "IntrusionSensorRearm" attribute, not "IntrusionSensor". So my patching to IntrusionSensor is for the purpose I mentioned in the commit msg about writing "Normal" to "IntrusionSensor" to manually rearm the sensor.

    Moreover, Redfish Data Model Specification says
    about IntrusionSensor that "If the IntrusionSensorReArm property
    contains Manual, a client may set this property to Normal to reset the
    physical security state"
    
This should be:

    Moreover, Redfish Data Model Specification says
    about the IntrusionSensor property that "If the IntrusionSensorReArm property
    contains Manual, a client may set the IntrusionSensor property to Normal to 
    reset the physical security state".
    
I quote the exact words from the spec and unintentionally make it confusing.
These two methods are pulling multiple properties from the same interface.  Please combine them into a single "GetAll" call, as is done elsewhere.
Updated to use GetAll

Please don't use auto in this context.

This is making a string copy, which you almost certainly didn't intend.
Done
str can be const reference.

Its class template says it "describes an object that can refer to a constant contiguous sequence of CharT..." so it is itself a const and we can't modify its content anyway. Moreover, std::string_view does not do any copy so we don't need a reference here also.
Is it ok to take argument as const reference when argument is going to be modified ?
This is taking a const reference of a ptr to a non-const, so modification to the value at the location it points to is fine. Just that we can't point it to somewhere else.
Thanks for your review. Ack. I will update.

As per my understanding/reading of unpackPropertiesNoThrow method. It won't return true and not set any one of given parameter. If return is true then all parameters must be set. If so then nullptr checks are irrelevant.
https://github.com/openbmc/sdbusplus/blob/master/include/sdbusplus/unpack_properties.hpp#L42

Refering other places in the source code is my reason behind this =.=. Looking carefully at the function definition, I don't know if I conclude too fast, but I think it can still pass by this line https://github.com/openbmc/sdbusplus/blob/757e1ad55c93e1c5a105e795d3bf87538072c238/include/sdbusplus/unpack_properties.hpp#L89 and return true if the *expectedKey* can't be found and the type of *outValue* is either an optional or a pointer (which is my case). Furthermore, I think checking against null before using a pointer is a good practice. Please correct me if I was wrong somewhere.
Done
Can you use a more descriptive name here?
Done
isn't there a more descriptive name you could use here?
Done
This lambda is huge, which is disallowed in the coding standard.  Please make it a normal method.  If that requires a refactor of the existing code, please do it in a patch before this one.
I have moved them into a function. It doesn't change much of the existing code so I didn't create another patch.

If this section is missing from entity manager configuration, What should happen?
In our case, bmcweb is crashing. Could you please test on your platform?
Sorry, I didn't let it check the case when GetSubTree returns empty, so line 265 failed. Updated. Thanks for your testing
more detail needed here.  Why is it ok to remove a parameter?  I'm assuming this can be something like "It was previously hardcoded, so nobody should be making use of it"
Updated. Please help check. However, I don't quite understand the explanation of this removal from the spec. I just don't see its use from the beginning.
What I'm asking for is why it's ok for OpenBMC to remove it, not why DMTF deprecated it.  The answer is because it was always hardcoded, therefore there was never any way a client could be using it.
Done

please don't make this a variant.  This should return a single enum, not multiple.  As written, this can put unallowed values on Redfish.

What I suspect you should do is to create two methods.  One from dbus -> Chassis::IntrusionSensor and one from dbus -> Chassis::IntrustionSensorRearm.

There is nowhere else in the code that we follow the pattern here of using a variant.
Updated as your suggestion. Thank you.
Are these properties optional in the interface?  If not, they should be required (and not be a pointer).  we only use optional properties for when a property is added to an interface later.
Updated.
This function is called out by name in COMMON_ERRORS.md.  Please read it and understand why it's disallowed.
Updated.
Not all paths put a value into this variable.  If line 166 is false, Invalid will be put on redfish.  Please follow the patterns we follow in the rest of the code, and handle errors appropriately.
Updated.
I'm assuming this means "adding"?
I meant the GET method. Updated.
deprecates
"this" is ambiguous here.  I'm assuming you mean "this commit"
Done
Done
so there are no clients that could be using this, and per COMPATIBILITY.md, this is not a compatibility break.
Done. Thank you.
it looks like this move got removed, which is fine, but please put refactors like that in their own commits.
Ack
If there's no way for this method to return a std::nullopt, then there's no reason for this to be an optional.
Thank you. Updated.

looks like a missing 
if (intrusionSensorReArm) here
Changed to non-optional variable.
this got changed from INFO -> WARNING.   INFO was correct before, lack of an intrusion sensor is not an error.
Done
You need to handle errors if there are more than one.
Done

Per the coding standard, please do not make lambdas that are more than a couple of lines.  I realize the previous lambda didn't already follow this rule, but this commit makes the lambda twice as long, and adds a new lambda scope, making the problem significantly worse.  Please refactor this method in a commit ahead of yours, then make the modifications you're intending.
I have added a commit to clean up some lengthy lambda functions in the file. Please help check. https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/67115/1
Done

I don't see anything in this call that ensures that the chassis intrusion object is for THIST chassis.  As written, this is going to allow patching on all chassis, which will forward to the primary chassis.  That's not correct, there should only be one chassis that allows patch.

I added a commit that lets getMainChassisId() function in redifsh_util.hpp only look for the main chassis with the xyz.openbmc_project.Iventory.Item.Chassis interface (instead of both Item.Chassis and Item.Board like before) and uses the function to check if this PATCHING is from the main chassis, please help check https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/67116/1
Please read and understand the coding standard.  No non-trivial lambda callbacks.
Ack
Any documentation updates needed?
I'm pretty sure there's other commits in review deprecating this property.  Please take a look at them.
I can't find that one, if you happen to see it again, can you please help leave the link?
I'm a little surprised we're setting a property here.  I would've assumed this would be a "rearm" method, given that it likely needs to touch hardware.  Was that discussed somewhere.

There are two methods of "rearming" the intrusion sensor: Automatic and Manual. In Auto mode, the sensor is showing the intrusion state real time, which means that closing the chassis cover after an intrusion event will restore the sensor state. However, in Manual mode, it expects a manual rearm "to the sensor" to restore its normal state, which means after an intrusion event, the IntrusionSensor will remain HardwareIntrusion (even when we re-attach the cover) until a rearm action is done for it to be restored back to Normal.

In https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/Chassis.v1_24_0.json, longDescription of property IntrusionSensor under Chassis/PhysicalSecurity says: "This property shall contain the physical security state of the chassis.  If the IntrusionSensorReArm property contains `Manual`, a client may set this property to `Normal` to reset the physical security state". So this is kind of a rearm by software to the sensor.

Therefore, when I added the Rearm property to chassis intrusion sensor interface in dbus-sensors (https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/58205), we expect the rearm action to be executed via Redfish (by patching Normal to Chassis/chassis/PhysicalSecurity/Intrusionsensor, it writes Normal to the Status property on DBus and restores the sensor).
Do we need to be setting the @AllowedValues to specify this?

Redfish schema does not say we can't write anything other than Normal to it, it just says "a client may set this property to Normal to reset the physical security state". However, in dbus-sensors, we only process Normal value written to the property on DBus (writing others to it causes no effect), so I log the error here.
Right..... which is why @AllowedValues would be specified, to inform the user that Normal is allowed.

DMTF says they will consider adding AllowableValues to schema (https://redfishforum.com/thread/993/intrusionsensor-allowablevalues). I added ["PhysicalSecurity"]["IntrusionSensor@Redfish.AllowableValues"] = nlohmann::json::array_t({"Normal"});
This is going to get ALL intrusion sensors, not just the one we're looking for.
Updated to match the result from getSubTree with the association endpoint to find the desired sensor.
This doesn't look right.  We need to be getting the Intrusion interface for THIS chassis (based on chassisId) not just getting the main chassis intrusion for all chassis.

In dbus-sensors, for now, it expects to only have one chassis intrusion sensor for one given system and there's currently no association between the sensor and a chassis intrusion sensor. I think I need to add the association.

If we add the intrusion sensor to the /all_sensors <-> /chassis association with the chassis whose EntityManager config the sensor is configured in, that chassis will have the PhysicalSecurity attribute. In this case, what should be shown in PhysicalSecurity of other chassis or should it show nothing?

Thinking again, the intrusion sensor does not have a sensor interface to be legit into associations like /all_sensors <-> /chassis or /sensors <-> /inventory, but I don't know if the sensor is worth creating a new association between it and a chassis, and can't think of the name for it. Can you please help leave some comment on this? (its interface is in PDI at https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Chassis/Intrusion.interface.yaml)

> In dbus-sensors, for now, it expects to only have one chassis intrusion sensor for one given system

That's fine, but it needs to be attached to the chassis that it's defined in, not all chassis.

> I don't know if the sensor is worth creating a new association between it and a chassis

I suspect it probably is worth an association.

The association monitored_by/monitoring between a chassis and an intrusion sensor has been merged to PDI (https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/67957) and the patch to register the association on DBus is under review at https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/68060/3.

Now this will use the association to look for the sensor associated with the chassis in request.
this is not how to do this lookup.  A chassis makes an intrusion interface available via dbus.  This code shouldn't care what the "primary" chassis is.
Removed.
